title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Apple warned that shipments of its high-end iPhone models would be hindered amid Covid-19 restrictions at one of its major suppliers in China.

Merger activity dropped 43% in recent months and initial public offerings of stock plummeted to their lowest level in more than a decade as the Fed's rate increases siphoned capital out of the markets.

Shale companies are slowing their oil-field activity, keeping U.S. oil production roughly flat and offering little relief for tight global markets.

Berkshire Hathaway swung to a loss as a volatile stock market and losses from insurance underwriting offset gains in its manufacturing, service and retail businesses.

Walgreens is near a deal to combine a unit with the owner of CityMD.

What's News: Business & Finance
